api

Interface IPhysicsEngine

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    PhysicsEngine

    public interface IPhysicsEngine
    Interface for the physics engine
    Author:
    Tom Wu

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean applyImpulse(IEntity body, Impulse J)
      Useful for debugging but will be deprecated! Applies impulse J to IEntity body
      IEntitySystem update(IEntitySystem universe, double dt)
      Update Positions of IEntities in universe based on dt and their Velocities
      IEntitySystem updateCollisions(IEntitySystem universe, boolean dynamicsOn)
      Marks Collision IComponents of applicable IEntities in universe with appropriate collidingIDs

    • Method Detail

      • update

        IEntitySystem update(IEntitySystem universe,
                     double dt)
        Update Positions of IEntities in universe based on dt and their Velocities
        Parameters:
        universe - IEntitySystem containing IEntities with both Positions and Velocities
        dt - duration of update in seconds
        Returns:
        updated universe

      • updateCollisions

        IEntitySystem updateCollisions(IEntitySystem universe,
                               boolean dynamicsOn)
        Marks Collision IComponents of applicable IEntities in universe with appropriate collidingIDs
        Parameters:
        universe - IEntitySystem containing IEntities with both Positions and Collisions
        dynamicsOn - if true, then impulses are subsequently applied to applicable IEntities (with Mass, Position, Velocity, and of course, Collision)
        Returns:
        updated universe

      • applyImpulse

        boolean applyImpulse(IEntity body,
                     Impulse J)
        Useful for debugging but will be deprecated! Applies impulse J to IEntity body
        Parameters:
        body - IEntity with Mass, Position, and Velocity
        J - Impulse vector used to calculate the updated Velocity
        Returns:
        whether J is successfully applied to body (false if body does not have Mass, Position, and Velocity)
